body: Thanks for the fix @dinithis! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.

@dinithis If this pull request is not valid now, would you mind closing it?
Thanks
Thanks for the fix @dinithis! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks for the fix @SupunrWork!! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks for the fix @chamilad!! I have now merged this pull request to master branch. It would be great if you can update the PCA live test or implement a unit test to verify this scenario.
Thanks for the fix @dinithis! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks for the fix @dinithis! I have now merged this pull request to 4.1.0-beta-deployment-policy-fix branch. Please add a description to this and close.
Seems something went wrong with this PR. Why there are 58 commits?
I got some unnecessary commits to my git repo. So I roll back those.

I guess you can do the following;
1. take this diff
2. reset your local git repo branch (sajithswa:master) with apache master branch (apache:master)
3. apply the diff
4. send the PR
Since you have sent a different PR with these changes, can you please close this PR?
Sure.
Thanks for the fix @dinithis! I have now merged this to 4.1.0-beta-deployment-policy-fix branch.

Thanks for the pull request @chamilad! It looks good! IMO it would be better to introduce a packaging model for plugins using zip to make it easier to distribute and deploy. I have now merged this to master branch.

@chamilad There are some conflicts in your change. Can you please fix them?
Thanks
Solved merge conflicts and re opened PR236.
Thanks for the modification @chamilad! I have now merged this to master branch.
Thanks @imesh !

Thanks for the pull request @dinithis! I have now merged this to 4.1.0-beta-deployment-policy-fix branch.

Thanks for the fix Dinithi.
Pull request looks good Dinithi! I have now merged it to master branch.
Noted. Will do the changes and commit them.
Did some refactoring and improvements.

A great effort @Vishanth! You have done a great job in refactoring the cartridge classes in cloud controller and now it looks very good, hope you tested this on different IaaS platforms. I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks
Thanks @prabathabey for the feedback. Will do those changes.

@anuruddhal Please add a description to this pull request.
Thanks
Closing hence merged.

@Vishanth Would you mind resolving the conflicts in this pull request?
Thanks

Thanks @anuruddhal for the fixes, as I can see there are merge conflicts in this pull request now. Would you mind resolving them?
Thanks

@imesh Will do the needful.
Regards.
@imesh Sorry the changes removed while working on another task. Will redo this and send a fresh PR.
Resent in PR https://github.com/apache/stratos/pull/294
merged in commit 52c5e93d9fc0aaec470f1d839da36fc029dea7ec

Hi @imesh, I have made the suggested changes and committed into this PR.
Please review again and merge. Regards.
@lafernando Removed the hyphens in https://github.com/apache/stratos/pull/313
@Vishanth Please fix merge conflicts.
@imesh resolved the merge conflicts

@anuruddhal Please fix the merge conflict.
Thanks

The merge process fails at the following commit:
Rebasing pr_313 on master...
error: could not apply 605bd70... Changes to the CLI commands

I have fixed the merge conflicts.
Thanks
Will resend this in another PR.

Hi Vishanth,
Can you include application-id, cluster-instance-id and network-partition-id also to these logs? So that it will be more descriptive..

@rekathiru I have now added 
- application id
- cluster id
- cluster instance id
- network partition id
- partition id
@udaraliyanage there is a requirement for those logs to be more informative
Thanks Pubudu.

Thanks Pubudu! I have now merged this to master branch, due to some reason it did not automatically change the state to merged. Please close this manually.
Thanks
I have fixed both tenant activate and deactivate cli issues. Please review and merge.

Thanks Pubudu! I have now merged this to master branch, please close the pull request manually.
Thanks
@imesh Seems like this has been fixed in some later commits. So we can close this PR.

Can you use different variable in validateGroupsRecursively for hasDP when you assign value to this variable inside the method? Otherwise this variable will get overwritten by the method and the validation would get failed for rest of the groups.

Anuruddha: The merge process failed with the following:

Falling back to patching base and 3-way merge...
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in components/org.apache.stratos.rest.endpoint/src/main/java/org/apache/stratos/rest/endpoint/util/converter/ObjectConverter.java
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in components/org.apache.stratos.common/src/main/java/org/apache/stratos/common/client/CloudControllerServiceClient.java

Hi Imesh,

I haven't done any changes in classes that have merge conflicts. And in the git hub it says "This pull request can be automatically merged by project collaborators." 

Shall I resend the PR ?
Is your local branch up to date with the remote? May be that's the problem.

Hi Pubudu, the merge process failed with the following error, can you please try to update your local branch with the remote and update this pull request?

Auto-merging components/org.apache.stratos.rest.endpoint/src/main/java/org/apache/stratos/rest/endpoint/api/StratosApiV41.java
CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in components/org.apache.stratos.rest.endpoint/src/main/java/org/apache/stratos/rest/endpoint/api/StratosApiV41.java
Failed to merge in the changes.
Patch failed at 0005 Fix Exception handling in addCartridgeGroup method

Thanks
Hi Imesh, I updated my local branch and merged with the master. Can you check now?

Thanks for the quick response! It looks like still we have a problem:

CONFLICT (content): Merge conflict in components/org.apache.stratos.rest.endpoint/src/main/java/org/apache/stratos/rest/endpoint/api/StratosApiV41Utils.java
Failed to merge in the changes.
Patch failed at 0001 Adding a local variable for recursive group validate method

Hi Imesh,
I reverted all the commits made to the branch and committed again. I think now you should be able to merge. Sorry for the inconvenience caused.
Thank you.

I have now updated branch with remote. 
Can you please try again !
Thanks Pubudu!! That worked, I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks Anuruddha, that worked! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks @JaneAarthy for the pull request. We might need to wait until we release Stratos 4.1.0 to merge this pull request.
Thanks for the fix Pubudu!! I have now merged this pull request to master branch.
Thanks Akila, I already fixed this and committed. Thanks for looking into this.
Thanks Pubudu! I have now merged this to master branch. This fix needs to be included in 4.1.0 release.
Is it possible to avoid jar file?( DAS-Artifacts/sparkudf-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar)

Thanuja: Please provide a description for your pull request explaining features that you have implemented. As I can see there is a problem in your commits, it cannot be merged:
error: could not apply 76c7724... Publishing events for Metering Service Implementation
Closing this to make one commit for all the changes.

@JaneAarthy Shall we move this feature implementation to database-model branch? If so may be you can close this pull request and send a new one.
Thanks
moving the changes to the database-model branch

@Thanuja This pull request has included others commits. There are 229 files changed. It would be better if you can only include your changes. May be your fork repository is not up to date with the remote.
Closing this p/r to avoid including others commits.

Great work Pubudu! I have now merged this to master branch. Please close the pull request.
Thanks

Hi Thanuja,

Please add the application null check to the if condition. Otherwise there could be a possibility for NPE in the following if condition.
               if (application.getInstanceContextCount() > 0
                         || (applicationContext != null &&
                         applicationContext.getStatus().equals("Deployed"))) {
Sorry for the noise..There was a NULL check already added in the code. So no need of doing it..

@Thanuja we might not be able to merge this to master branch at this stage. You might need to send this pull request again to data-publisher-integration branch.
Thanks

Hi Asanka,

Please use the log.error(object,throwable) method when you are log the error logs with the exception catch block. This is the standard we have followed through Stratos code base.
Ok. I'll close this and send it to data-publisher-integration branch.
I haven't check any formatting issue. This is just to merge master branch changes to data-publisher-integration. IMO it's better to do this in master branch.

Thanks for the pull request Pubudu! Please provide a description explaining the changes you have done in this and the reasons for them.
Thanks
I now have added a detailed description for the changes that I have made.
Closing this P/R to send it to tenant-isolation branch.
New PR created with updated changes. Closing this one.
These fixes are now merged to master branch.
